SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

no.uio.duo.bagit
Class BagIt

java.lang.Object
  no.uio.duo.bagit.BagIt

public class BagIt
extends java.lang.Object

Main class which manages interactions with a StudentWeb formatted BagIt file. This allows the BagIt packages to be constructed from files on disk, or for a zipped BagIt to be read and opened. The StudentWeb Bag format is as follows: 

 base directory/
 |   bagit.txt
 |   manifest-md5.txt
 |   tagmanifest-md5.txt
 \--- data/
      \--- final
          |   [final version files]
      \--- supporting
          |   [supporting files]
      \--- licence/
          |   licence.txt
      \--- metadata/
          |   metadata.xml
      \--- tagfiles/
          |   supporting.access.txt
          |   formats.txt
          |   final.sequence.txt
          |   supporting.sequence.txt

addFinalFile

public void addFinalFile(java.io.File file,
                         int sequence)
Add a file to the Bag, which is a final version file of the item (see the class documentation regarding structure of the Bag). Give it the specified sequence number in the list of final files

Parameters:
file - File object to add to the Bag
sequence - position in the sequence of final files in the Bag

addFinalFile

public void addFinalFile(java.io.File file,
                         java.lang.String mimeType,
                         int sequence)
Add a file to the Bag, which is a final version file of the item (see the class documentation regarding structure of the Bag). Give it the specified mime type and sequence number in the list of final files

Parameters:
file - File object to add to the Bag
mimeType - Mimetype of the file object. If this is null, we will attempt to guess
sequence - position in the sequence of final files in the Bag. If this is -1 we will just add it to the end of the current list

addSupportingFile

public void addSupportingFile(java.io.File file,
                              java.lang.String access)
Add a file to the Bag, which is supporting material for the item (see the class documentation regarding structure of the Bag). Give it the access type specified.

Parameters:
file - File object to add to the Bag
access - Access conditions of the item. Should be "open" or "closed"

addSupportingFile

public void addSupportingFile(java.io.File file,
                              int sequence,
                              java.lang.String access)
Add a file to the Bag, which is supporting material for the item (see the class documentation regarding structure of the Bag). Give it the access type specified, and the position specified by the sequence in the existing list of supporting files

Parameters:
file - File object to add to the Bag
sequence - position in the sequence of final files in the Bag. If this is -1 we will just add it to the end of the current list
access - Access conditions of the item. Should be "open" or "closed"

Parameters:

mimeType - Mimetype of the file object. If this is null, we will attempt to guess
sequence - position in the sequence of final files in the Bag. If this is -1 we will just add it to the end of the current list
access - Access conditions of the item. Should be "open" or "closed"
